questions.question_text: A user's smartphone has been experiencing performance issues, and it needs to be charged more often. A technician also notices there have been spikes in the smartphone's CPU and memory usage. Which of the following would MOST likely help to improve the performance of the smartphone?

discussion.content: What's an example of unnecessary services ?

comments.content: IMAP should be used, instead of POP3. It's Better Option. It looks like, the antivirus are blocking the pop3 port.
especially after they stated that POP3 configurations are correct

discussion.content: How is this the correct answer?

choices.D: The user is not connected to the Internet.
choices.C: The user needs to enable TLS.
choices.B: The email password stored is incorrect.
choices.A: The POP3 port is being blocked.

questions.question_text:
A user is not receiving emails on a laptop. A technician is able to send emails using the local client; however, no new emails are being received. The POP3 and
SMTP settings in the corporate email configuration look correct. The technician notices a new antivirus program was installed on the machine recently. Which of the following is MOST likely causing the problem?

A technician was called to check an unexpected clicking noise on a desktop that has become more frequent every time a video editing application is loaded. The system fans have been replaced, but the clicking noise remains. Diagnostics have been run on the video card.
Which of the following should the technician do FIRST?

discussion.content: Do a full backup first just in case. This seems like a hard drive failing.

comments.content: I totally agree here most of the time the sound is coming from a failing drive or a RAID array so the first step is to do System backup and then scan for antivirus.

discussion.content: The clicking sound is basically coming from a failing hard drive, so an immediate backup is recommended in case the drive fails.
I think correct answer if F

comments.content:
so the first step is to do System backup and then scan for antivirus. Because data is more important than scanning a drive here. 

Working as an IT tech this is what you have to do in your first step and it is very important if you miss this step your manager will be pissed and could ended up firing you from a job.

questions.question_text: A technician is upgrading a lab to VDI using thin client computers. The lab previously used laptops with a WiFi connection. Which of the following is required for the thin clients to operate?

discussion.content: Wait.. How is the Thin Client going to work without a Mouse and Keyboard ?

questions.question_text: A technician receives a laptop due to its low performance and intermittent S.M.A.R.T. errors on boot up. Which of the following is the NEXT step the technician should take to diagnose the issue?

choices.D: Copy the user's profile folder to an external drive.
choices.B: Repair the OS installation on the existing drive.

discussion.content: SMART errors is an indication or a prediction that someday your drive is going to fail. Best course of action is to backup data then replace hard drive.
